intro: Leucopogon tamariscinus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. It plays an important role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
